dt: {bc}to rid of impurities by or as if by washing

dt.t: It's that mystical state most athletes are lucky to achieve a few times in their careers. The mind is {wi}cleansed{/wi}. The body is free.

dt: {bc}to expel, imprison, or kill (the members of an ethnic minority) in (an area) : to subject to or remove by {d_link|ethnic cleansing|ethnic cleansing}

dt.t: In 1996, tens of thousands of ethnic Tutsis, most of them of Rwandan origin, were murdered or ethnically {wi}cleansed{/wi} in the Masisi region of eastern Zaire.

dt: {bc}to engage in or undergo a {d_link|cleanse|cleanse:2} to remove toxins from the body

dt.t: Some people who {wi}cleanse{/wi} say they experience dramatic physical changes.

et: Middle English {it}clensen{/it}, from Old English {it}clǣnsian{/it} to purify, from {it}clǣne{/it} clean
shortdef: clean; especially : to rid of impurities by or as if by washing
to expel, imprison, or kill (the members of an ethnic minority) in (an area) : to subject to or remove by ethnic cleansing
to engage in or undergo a cleanse to remove toxins from the body
